This is one of my must see shows and I will be most disappointed when Chris Kimbell leaves.
What can I say, just love the show especially at dinner.

Cooks Corner has been on PBS for more than eight seasons. I watch it periodically but not all the time. And when I find a recipe I want to try, I have to watch it a few times to get it right. Thats why I like the DVDs.

But, one function I REALLY like is you can watch a series of segments all at once. What I mean by this is that each episode of the show has a few recipe segments, but there are also product reviews  like non-stick pans or coffee makers  and food tastings ( best frozen dinner rolls or best grapefruit juice). These last two types of segments, youll probably only want to watch once. So I put in a DVD (there are two discs in this set) and watch the review sections back to back (these take about 30 minutes each). Then I go to the recipes.

Im not a really creative cook and so I don't choose recipes that are high in calories or complicated. But in this season the Roast Chicken with potatoes  shown on the DVD cover  caught my eye and I made it the night I watched it. It went over great. I also tried the smoked bourbon chicken. There are some more Ive yet to get to.

There are many cooking shows on TV but, for some reason  I guess its the variety  I like this one.

The DVDs also contain a pdf of all the recipes that you can print out.

I hope you found this review both informative and helpful.

Steve Ramm
Anything Phonographic
I love the content of the DVD, it's one of my favorite cooking programs.  The DVD has good audio,it's easy to hear over the sound of my treadmill.
Had to get all the seasons!!

So, this is a great PBS series in a few ways.

- Christopher Kimball and the other cast fit well together, it's a well balance cast
- Kitchen equipment testing is a part of each episode, and always helpful
- Food product testing is also a section of each episode, and are atleast entertaining, and also usually useful information you didn't know before
- Recipes are easy to follow

All in all, excellent series worth spending 20$ to own each season in my opinion.
Great advice for bringing great cooking to the ordinary home cook.
Learn lots of new things like the cast
Christopher Kimball is a kitchen god, and he doesn't even know it.
